result.execSummary:
The defendant Drury James Niebuhr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any sentence now serving

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drury James Niebuhr

records.addlTxt: 8:58 AM Defendant Drury James Niebuhr in court.  Attorney Kevin M Smith in court for Drury James Niebuhr.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin. Orally amended on the record. State to file amended information by end of day. Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant waives his right to a presentence investigation. Court orders 3 years probation consecutive to any sentence now serving and costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 0 days.
Notice of Hearing for Calendar Call on September 28, 2022 at 8:45am, NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER (Defendant Drury James Niebuhr)
Calendar call on September 28, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity:Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:10 PM Defendant Drury James Niebuhr in court by video with attorney Colin Nicholson by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson  and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
Notice of Hearing Initial appearance May 16, 2022 at 1:00pm   NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER (Drury James Niebuhr)

Activity:Initial Appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case under the influence, cannot possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription,  Maintain absolute sobriety, must reside at residence between 6PM-6AM unless traveling to or from work.

1:15 PM Defendant Drury James Niebuhr in court by zoom video with attorney Kevin M Smith by zoom video, Noah M Tylenda appeared for the State of Wisconsin by zoom video.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1,000 with conditions,  Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case under the influence, cannot possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription,  Maintain absolute sobriety, must reside at residence between 6PM-6AM unless traveling to or from work. Defendant to sign bond May 17 2022 between noon and 1PM.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
